Meta.ShortDescription: a rare disease in which the bone marrow and the hematopoietic stem cells that reside there are damaged, causing a deficiency in all three blood cell types.

Symptoms.Symptom: Infections, due to low WBC count

Causes.Cause: Exposure to certain chemicals, drugs, radiation or infection

Diagnostics.Diagnostic: Patient history of exposure to cytotoxic chemotherapy
Blood test for paroxysmal nocturnal hemoglobinuria

Treatments.Treatment: Low platelet count in blood tests
Treatment with antithymocyte globulin (ATG) and several months of ciclosporin to modulate the immune system
